intro: Bridelia stipularis, commonly known as the African bridlewood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Bridelia stipularis is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
